text: Listen to ‘The Sunday Read’“Kamala Harris, Mass Incarceration and Me” examines the criminal justice system.
Modern Love PodcastThey were doomed from the start. But they dated anyway.
Listen to ‘Sway’Lina Khan is taking on Silicon Valley’s most powerful men.

He Already Saw the Election as Good vs. Evil. Then His Tractor Burned.In Nebraska, President Trump’s supporters hope he wins, and that they get four more years of feeling like the country’s leader understands and defends them.

Analysis: Dishonesty Has Defined Trump’s Presidency. The Consequences Could Be Lasting.Whether President Trump wins or loses, the concept of public trust in a set of facts necessary for the operation of a democratic society has been eroded.

Election at Hand, Biden Leads Trump in Four Key States, Poll ShowsJoe Biden holds a clear advantage over President Trump in Pennsylvania, Florida, Arizona and Wisconsin, a New York Times/Siena College poll shows.

To Trump, ‘the Polls That Matter’ Point to Victory. The Rest Are ‘Fake.’President Trump’s blinkered view of 2020 polling has created something of an alternate universe, even as his campaign struggles.
The Battlegrounds Within BattlegroundsHere are 20 counties that are crucial for a victory.

For Trump The October Surprise Never Came: The Final Days Are Now About HimPresident Trump’s hope that an economic recovery, a Covid-19 vaccine or a Joe Biden scandal could shake up the race faded with the last light of October.
Inspiring Black Voters Is Key to Biden’s Prospects in FloridaDemocratic groups are pouring money into get-out-the-vote efforts in Black precincts to try to increase turnout from 2016.
Ahead of Election, Police Prepare for Violence and DisruptionMany law enforcement officials have attempted to inject calm while warning of dire consequences for those who try to disrupt voting.
How a yearslong battle over U.S.-Venezuela relations aided President Trump’s campaign in Florida — and left the Maduro regime standing.
In San Francisco, Virus Is Contained but Schools Are Still ClosedA debate over reopening classrooms pits the mayor against the Board of Education, cutting across class, party and racial lines.

How the Wealthy World Has Failed Poor Countries During the PandemicDespite pledges for debt relief and expanded programs, the World Bank and International Monetary Fund have delivered meager aid, say economists.
President Trump leaving the Walter Reed medical center after undergoing four days of treatment for Covid-19. Doug Mills/The New York Times

States Undercount Positive Rapid Tests, Masking the Spread of DiseaseHealth officials say an influx of rapid, inexpensive tests is good for the country, but caution that they are struggling to count those who test positive.
